author: John Anderson
title: ‘2 Dope Queens’ Review: Polished Comedy That Feels Spontaneous
text: The casually regal Jessica Williams was one of the better things about “The Daily Show” under the Jon Stewart administration, and with “2 Dope Queens” she and cohort Phoebe Robinson offer hope for cable comedy, currently a smorgasbord of the raw and the undercooked. Based on their almost-two-year-old podcast of the same name, the show poses the two comedians as ostensible hosts, warming up the crowd, introducing other comics, even doing interviews—Mr. Stewart is the first, engaging somewhat reluctantly in a pizza taste-off between pies from Queens and Brooklyn. Much of what they do feels improvised, and is supposed to;...
